newsitem.title: ITALY: Fiat/New Holland unit seeks $500 mln loan.
newsitem.headline: Fiat/New Holland unit seeks $500 mln loan.

text.p: Fiat Finance USA, part of New Holland NV, has asked Chase Investment Bank and Citicorp Securities to organise a medium term line of credit for $500 million, a Fiat statement said.
The five year facility will be set at 15 basis points over LIBOR and the utilisation fee will be one basis point for use above one-third and 2.5 basis points for use above two-thirds.
The commitment fee will be 7.5 basis points per year.
Chase Manhattan Bank and Citibank had entirely underwritten the facility and launched the syndication of the operation on the market, the Fiat statement said.
ABN Amro, Banca di Roma, Banque Nationale de Paris, Deutsche Bank and IBJ had already confirmed participation in the operation in the capacity of senior lead managers.
The facility will be guaranteed by International Holding Fiat SA and is the first syndicated operation launched by Fiat on the U.S. market.
The funds will be used to finance sales to New Holland clients through the New Holland Credit Co, the group's U.S. financial services company.
